Description: Parents asked family to leave without informing them of decision to extubate
Primary NICU team was not consulted
Single on-call  ethics consultant makes decision
Premature withdrawal while prognosis is still uncertain
Possible clinician bias / stereotyping of evangelical beliefs
Dual‑role conflict: ethicist was the child’s prior ED physician
Potential disability bias in weighing future quality of life
Determining best‑interest vs. significant‑harm threshold for parental authority
Deciding state/legal intervention is not warranted
Timing of withdrawal before/after paralytics wear off (risk of hastening death)
